channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15646] Add some docs about exporting and importing snapshots using S3
item.description: Got a request to add this and wrote something up using the info I could scrounge together.
item.summary: Add some docs about exporting and importing snapshots using S3

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Do we have minimum version information for either HBase or Hadoop (presuming that's where the s3a connector lives) for the export snapshot to S3 working?
If the dependency is on Hadoop then it's Hadoop 2.6 which I believe is HBase 1.0. Right?

-1 overall

If the dependency is on Hadoop then it's Hadoop 2.6 which I believe is HBase 1.0. Right?

It's only supported as of HBase 1.2, it's listed as Not Tested before that. Presuming that HBase 1.0 is the minimum requirement for the snapshot command, I think your phrasing is okay. I would update the Hadoop requirement to Hadoop 2.6.1+, since we expressly don't support Hadoop 2.6.0. Probably also pointing folks to the prerequisites table on Hadoop there, so they're aware of the testing situation between HBase x Hadoop versions.

http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#hadoop

-1 overall

looks ok to me. maybe expand more around why you need "HBase 1.0 or higher and Hadoop 2.6". I guess this is connected to the line below where you talk about s3n. (also in that line change the: do not use the official "Amazon APIs" with "Amazon AWS SDK").

This version addresses Matteo's feedback and also adds a section about using Azure Blob Storage.

v3 looks good to me, the only strange sounding thing to me is in the first part "Using Amazon S3 Storage" where you say:

However, some HBase clusters are successfully using Amazon S3 buckets, typically in the context of Amazon Elastic Mapreduce (Amazon EMR).

I have no idea what "using s3 buckets in the context of EMR" means. do you mean s3 used to fully replace hdfs (which I think is not the case) or used for snapshot like you are describing below or some other use case?
I don't know what I mean, I can take it out if it will close out this issue.
yeah, remove that However part, or just replace it with something like "s3 and azure can be used to store snapshots (see below)"
Take out the confusing part about EMR
Pushed to master. Thanks for the review, Matteo Bertozzi

-1 overall
